page.title: 06CARE OF THE ELDERLY
page.content:
FEATURES PROMINENTLY IN BURROUGH. RETIRING AGE IS 60 FOR WOMEN AND 65 FOR
MEN. THERE ARE 6 MODERNISED BUNGALOWS CETRALLY-HEATED WITH EITHER ELECTRICITY SOLID FUEL AND DOUBLE-GLAZED WINDOWS. MEALS-ON-WHEELS ARE DELIVERED VOLUNTARILY FROM A FACTORY IN MELTON, AVAILABLE TO THE FRAIL ELDERLY WHO MAY ALSO HAVE A HOME HELP TO DO HOUSEHOLD TASKS WHICH THEY FIND DIFFICULT. THESE ARE PROVIDED BY THE COUNTY COUNCIL & PAYMENT IS ACCORDING TO INCOME. RECOMMENDATION IS GIVEN BY THE DOCTOR.THRE SOCIAL CLUBS AVAILABLE, ONE IN TWYFORD AND ONE IN SOMERBY. VOLUNTARY TRANSPORT IS PROVIDED TO SOMERBY IF NEEDED.THERE IS A MEETING EVEY 2 WEEKS IN THE VILLAGE HALL WITH SPEAKERS, BINGO, CARD GAMES AND OUTINGS.
